meanings.definition: A unit of traffic intensity in telecommunications.
meanings.sent1: The erlang measurement helps determine the traffic load on the network.
meanings.sent2: The technician calculated the erlang value to optimize the phone system.
meanings.sent3: The erlang unit decided to take a break from all the network traffic.
meanings.sent4: The erlang level on the network was as busy as a rush hour traffic jam.
meanings.sent5: The concept of erlang made the telecommunications traffic easier to understand.

meanings.definition: A programming language used for concurrent, real-time systems.
meanings.sent1: Developers use erlang to create efficient real-time applications.
meanings.sent2: She learned erlang to build programs that run simultaneously.
meanings.sent3: The erlang programming language decided to have a party with Python and Java.
meanings.sent4: In the world of programming, erlang shines like a bright star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: Learning erlang opened up a whole new world of possibilities for the developer.
